channel.title: Mass Clicking
channel.description: Is there any way at all to get rid of this? I'm just so sick of people mass clicking on my server.

item.title: Mass Clicking
item.dc:creator: @csrsniper254 csrsniper254
item.description:
@csrsniper254 wrote:

[quote=“masterp00n, post:10, topic:57816”][quote author=Javacisnotrecognized link=topic=82717.msg893470#msg893470 date=1171343419]
Why don’t you look at the begginning half of my first response.
[/quote]You should be more nicer instead of being stupid and not makin him feel confirtable and making him say "omg thank you very much dude you rock"Now I always wonder myself how you got moparscape cm[/quote]

Masterpoon, by simply telling people the answer to this how will they benifit from it? This will appear more than once while hosting a server. By Javac stating:

Well, let’s see. How would you go about stopping someone, who could possibly be thousands of miles away from you on the opposite side of the Earth, from clicking their mouse as fast as they want?

And why would it annoy you anyway

He is implying that you should first research how to stop this person. Which implies the question itself. So in the end he is really telling him to look somewhere else for the answer.

Read full topic

item.title: Mass Clicking
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

spid3rm4n:

Its called an action timer, they are very useful.

Not quite. The one in Testscape does it for certain objects - you have to add it to each individual object or whatever. If he does it the way I suggested (it is raised as soon as the packets are received by the server), then it saves a lot of coding.

Read full topic

item.title: Mass Clicking

item.description:
@spid3rm4n wrote:

Its called an action timer, they are very useful.

Read full topic

item.title: Mass Clicking
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

… If your server lags badly because of this, then it’s shit.

Of course, there are ways to sort of prevent it. But at the end of the day, they can still physically click.

Look in the parseIncomingPackets method - Add something that adds a value every time something is clicked (you’d need to do it for the attacking packets and the object clicking packets in particular I guess).

So say you used the variables clickCount and clickCountTimer.

When they click an object, clickCount++; and clickCountTimer = 10;

If they click more then 5 times before the timer hits 0 and resets the clickCount variable to 0, their name can be appended to the ban list. I’m not going to do this for you, but I’m certain I’ve explained it well enough for you to go from there.

EDIT: Changed what was being assigned to clickCountTimer lel.

Read full topic
